snippet: When the disease killing residents of Benin turned out to be Lassa fever, the World Health Organization used protocols for Ebola to stem the illness.
abstract: Lab tests have shown disease with Ebola-like symptoms that struck African country of Benin in fall 2014 to be Lassa fever, related virus never before identified in country; virus has since been contained by using protocols for Ebola.
lead_paragraph: When the disease killing residents of Benin turned out to be Lassa fever, the World Health Organization used protocols for Ebola to stem the illness.

headline.print_headline: Prepping for Ebola, Stopping Something Else
headline.main: Preparing for Ebola, but Stopping Lassa Fever
